meanings.definition: Make (something) seem less important or significant.
meanings.sent1: She downplayed the mistake to avoid getting in trouble.
meanings.sent2: He always downplayed his achievements, never wanting to boast.
meanings.sent3: The cat downplayed the size of the mouse it caught, pretending it was no big deal.
meanings.sent4: Her smile downplayed the sadness in her eyes, masking her true emotions.
meanings.sent5: The teacher downplayed the difficulty of the test, but it turned out to be quite challenging.

meanings.definition: Understate the importance or significance of.
meanings.sent1: They downplayed the impact of the storm, claiming it was just a light rain.
meanings.sent2: Politicians often downplay the effects of their decisions on the economy.
meanings.sent3: The comedian downplayed the size of the audience, joking that it was just a few friends.
meanings.sent4: His words downplayed the gravity of the situation, leaving everyone unaware of the danger.
meanings.sent5: The artist downplayed the beauty of her painting, but it left everyone in awe.
